required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: GIOTRIF rPMS in Korean Patients With NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: A Regulatory Requirement Post-marketing Surveillance Study to Monitor the Safety and Efficacy of GIOTRIF® (Afatinib Dimaleate, 20mg, 30mg, 40mg, q.d) in Korean Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) With Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) Mutations or Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic NSCLC of Squamous Histology Progressing on or After Platinum-based Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: To monitor the safety profile and efficacy of GIOTRIF® (afatinib dimaleate, q.d) in Korean patients with locally advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (Visit 1) until last visit (the last follow-up visit a patient actually attended during the study), up to 1051 days.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From week 0 until week 48. Up to 48 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) rate, defined as the percentage of patients who were alive and without disease progression at the 48-week tumour assessment. Progression was assessed by the investigator according to local standard pattern of care for non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). If a patient is known to have progressed, but the date of progression is not attainable, the last date when the patient was assessed will be used as date of progression. PFS rate at 48 weeks was estimated using Kaplan-Meier estimates on the PFS curve.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Best Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumour assessments performed at week 0, 8±2, 24±2 and 48±2. Up to 50 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Best response is defined as the best response observed in individual subject from the date of the first administration of the study medication until the earliest recording of Progressive disease (PD), death, or end of treatment (as long as no additional anti-cancer therapy was implemented). Disease Assessment will be based on the assessment of cancer related symptoms and, if available, radiologic assessments as per standard of care at the site. Tumour response according to investigator's assessment Each patient will be assigned to one of the following categories: Complete response (CR) Partial response (PR) Stable disease (SD) Progressive disease (PD) Not evaluable for response, reasons to be specified (e.g. early death, tumour assessments incomplete, etc.)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (Visit 1) until last visit (the last follow-up visit a patient actually attended during the study), up to 1051 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival (OS), defined as time from the date of the first administration of afatinib to the date of death. Kaplan-Meier estimates and 95% confidence intervals for the 25th, median, and 75th percentiles of the survival distribution will be calculated for OS. For patients with known date of death: OS [days] = date of death - (date of start of treatment) + 1 For patients known not death case: OS (censored) [days] = date of last contact showing no death - (date of start of treatment) + 1.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Patients who have been started on GIOTRIF® in accordance with the approved label in Korea
2. Age = 19 years at enrolment
3. Patients who have signed on the data release consent form
Exclusion criteria:
1. Known hypersensitivity to afatinib or any of its excipients
2. Patients with rare hereditary conditions of galactose intolerance, the Lapp lactase deficiency or glucose-galactose malabsorption
3. Patients for whom GIOTRIF® is contraindicated according to the local label

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This is an observational prospective, non-interventional, open-label, multi-centre national study in Korean patients with locally advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) mutations or patients with locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC of squamous histology progressing on or after platinum-based chemotherapy
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects were screened for eligibility prior to participation in the trial. Subjects were not to be allocated to a treatment group if any of the entry criteria were violated.

group.title: GIOTRIF®
group.description: GIOTRIF® was prescribed according to the local label and at the discretion of the treating physician. The physicians indicated doses and timing based on the current authorized label in Korea. Possible dosage were 20 milligram (mg), 30 mg and 40 mg administered orally, once daily, at least 1 hour before a meal or at least 3 hours after a meal, taken without food and swallowed whole with water.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Consented prior to the contract date

baseline.population: All Participants whose case report forms (CRFs) were retrieved during the re-examination period (29 Jan 2014 - 28 Jan 2020) and who did not violate the inclusion/exclusion criteria. 1 subject was excluded from the set based on disease indication.

group.title: GIOTRIF®
group.description: GIOTRIF® was prescribed according to the local label and at the discretion of the treating physician. The physicians indicated doses and timing based on the current authorized label in Korea. Possible dosage were 20 milligram (mg), 30 mg and 40 mg administered orally, once daily, at least 1 hour before a meal or at least 3 hours after a meal, taken without food and swallowed whole with water.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
measure.description: Percentage of participants with Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs).
measure.population: All Participants whose case report forms (CRFs) were retrieved during the re-examination period (29 Jan 2014 - 28 Jan 2020) and who did not violate the inclusion/exclusion criteria. 1 subject was excluded from the set based on disease indication.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) Rate at 48 Weeks
outcome.description: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) rate, defined as the percentage of patients who were alive and without disease progression at the 48-week tumour assessment. Progression was assessed by the investigator according to local standard pattern of care for non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). If a patient is known to have progressed, but the date of progression is not attainable, the last date when the patient was assessed will be used as date of progression. PFS rate at 48 weeks was estimated using Kaplan-Meier estimates on the PFS curve.
outcome.time_frame: From week 0 until week 48. Up to 48 weeks.
outcome.population: Effectiveness assessment set: all participants whose case report forms (CRFs) were retrieved during the re-examination period (29 Jan 2014 - 28 Jan 2020) and who did not violate the inclusion/exclusion criteria. 221 subjects were excluded due to missing effectiveness assessments.

group.title: GIOTRIF®
group.description: GIOTRIF® was prescribed according to the local label and at the discretion of the treating physician. The physicians indicated doses and timing based on the current authorized label in Korea. Possible dosage were 20 milligram (mg), 30 mg and 40 mg administered orally, once daily, at least 1 hour before a meal or at least 3 hours after a meal, taken without food and swallowed whole with water.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) Rate at 48 Weeks
measure.description: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) rate, defined as the percentage of patients who were alive and without disease progression at the 48-week tumour assessment. Progression was assessed by the investigator according to local standard pattern of care for non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). If a patient is known to have progressed, but the date of progression is not attainable, the last date when the patient was assessed will be used as date of progression. PFS rate at 48 weeks was estimated using Kaplan-Meier estimates on the PFS curve.
measure.population: Effectiveness assessment set: all participants whose case report forms (CRFs) were retrieved during the re-examination period (29 Jan 2014 - 28 Jan 2020) and who did not violate the inclusion/exclusion criteria. 221 subjects were excluded due to missing effectiveness assessments.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Best Response
outcome.description: Best response is defined as the best response observed in individual subject from the date of the first administration of the study medication until the earliest recording of Progressive disease (PD), death, or end of treatment (as long as no additional anti-cancer therapy was implemented). Disease Assessment will be based on the assessment of cancer related symptoms and, if available, radiologic assessments as per standard of care at the site. Tumour response according to investigator's assessment Each patient will be assigned to one of the following categories: Complete response (CR) Partial response (PR) Stable disease (SD) Progressive disease (PD) Not evaluable for response, reasons to be specified (e.g. early death, tumour assessments incomplete, etc.)
outcome.time_frame: Tumour assessments performed at week 0, 8±2, 24±2 and 48±2. Up to 50 weeks.
outcome.population: Effectiveness assessment set: all participants whose case report forms (CRFs) were retrieved during the re-examination period (29 Jan 2014 - 28 Jan 2020) and who did not violate the inclusion/exclusion criteria. 221 subjects were excluded due to missing effectiveness assessments, an additional 36 subjects were excluded for not completing the assessment at the last visit.

The physicians indicated doses and timing based on the current authorized label in Korea. Disease Assessment will be based on the assessment of cancer related symptoms and, if available, radiologic assessments as per standard of care at the site. outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: Overall Survival (OS), defined as time from the date of the first administration of afatinib to the date of death. Kaplan-Meier estimates and 95% confidence intervals for the 25th, median, and 75th percentiles of the survival distribution will be calculated for OS. For patients with known date of death: OS [days] = date of death - (date of start of treatment) + 1 For patients known not death case: OS (censored) [days] = date of last contact showing no death - (date of start of treatment) + 1.

measurement_list.measurement: The median and upper confidence interval could not be estimated due to the low number of deaths.

reported_events.time_frame: From baseline (Visit 1) until last visit (the last follow-up visit a patient actually attended during the study), up to 1051 days.
reported_events.desc: For this non interventional study, all 1272 participants whose case report forms (CRFs) were retrieved during the re-examination period (29 Jan 2014 - 28 Jan 2020) and who did not violate the inclusion/exclusion criteria were included. Among these, 6 participants were deemed not eligible retrospectively and were additionally excluded.

group.title: GIOTRIF®
group.description: GIOTRIF® was prescribed according to the local label and at the discretion of the treating physician. The physicians indicated doses and timing based on the current authorized label in Korea. Possible dosage were 20 milligram (mg), 30 mg and 40 mg administered orally, once daily, at least 1 hour before a meal or at least 3 hours after a meal, taken without food and swallowed whole with water.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
